topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Add a Service to an Existing Cluster

body.p: This example demonstrates how to add a service to a cluster that already exists.

section.title: Create a Bootstrap Configuration File
section.p: The code block provided below is an example of the bootstrap.yml text file that the cf-mgmt tool can use to import parameter values. You can download a sample file. Edit the file to fit your needs and save it in the same directory where the cf-mgmt tool is installed.
section.codeblock: constructor-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> services-on-core: false flavor: standard.medium
section.note: To add an existing Trove database, also include a value for the --database-instance-id parameter.

body.section: Linux Cluster: Add a MySQL ServiceRun the following set of commands. cf-mgmt.exe \ --os-auth-url <auth-url> \ --os-username <username> \ --os-password <password> \ --os-tenant-id <id> \ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" \ --os-region-name "<region-name>" \ add-service mysql \ --keypair-name <keypair name> \ --load bootstrap_service.yml

section.title: Windows Cluster: Add a SQL Server Service

ol.li: Add the Windows DEA Role cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <OS_AUTH_URL from openstackrc> ^ --os-username <OS_USERNAME from openstackrc> ^ --os-password <Openstack password> ^ --os-tenant-id <OS_TENANT_ID from openstackrc> ^ --os-tenant-name <OS_TENANT_NAME from openstackrc> ^ --os-region-name <OS_REGION_NAME from openstackrc> ^ add-role dea ^ --keypair-name <name of keypair created earlier> ^ --load http://clients.als.hpcloud.com/config/trial-windea.yml

Add the SQL Server 2014 Service cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <OS_AUTH_URL from openstackrc> ^ --os-username <OS_USERNAME from openstackrc> ^ --os-password <Openstack password> ^ --os-tenant-id <OS_TENANT_ID from openstackrc> ^ --os-tenant-name <OS_TENANT_NAME from openstackrc> ^ --os-region-name <OS_REGION_NAME from openstackrc> ^ add-service mssql2014 ^ --keypair-name <name of keypair created earlier> ^ --load http://clients.als.hpcloud.com/config/trial-mssql2014.yml
